thread.title: Siegel Football Player in Critical Condition after Football Injury
thread.title_full: Siegel Football Player in Critical Condition after Football Injury

title: Siegel Football Player in Critical Condition after Football Injury
text:
Siegel Football Player in Critical Condition after Football Injury Published: October 24, 2015 Print 
The Siegel community is praying for a junior football player injured during the high school's game at Warren County. Coach Greg Wyant tells NewsRadio WGNS wide receiver and defensive back Baylor Bramble suffered a head injury and is in very critical condition... 

It was his first career start. Wyant says Bramble took a hit, but walked off the field. After walking off the field, he had a seizure. Bramble was taken by Lifeflight to Vanderbilt Hospital around 11pm Friday night. He has swelling on the brain and is in very critical condition. A prayer vigil will be held at Northside Baptist Church Saturday at 4pm where his dad, David Bramble is an associate pastor. Related Articles
